thread.title: Uttar Pradesh boys, West Bengal girls champions
thread.title_full: Uttar Pradesh boys, West Bengal girls champions

title: Uttar Pradesh boys, West Bengal girls champions
text:
Uttar Pradesh boys, West Bengal girls champions Uttar Pradesh boys, West Bengal girls champions   
Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal emerged champions in the boys’ and girls’ categories respectively in the 24th Mini-National Volleyball championships at the Sree Kanteerava Indoor Stadium on Sunday. Uttar Pradesh boys got the better of Uttarakhand 25-19, 25-18, 25-23 in the summit clash while West Bengal defeated Haryana 25-15, 25-19, 25-20 in the girls’ final.The UP-Uttarakhand game began at a quick pace, with both the teams hitting powerful smashes and making good blocks. However, UP came out with some stunning blocks later in the set to pull away to a 17-12 lead, before Surya Pratap Singh and Gulfam produced some hard smashes to win it 25-19.Uttar Pradesh came out all guns blazing in the second set as they galloped to 23-16 lead in no time. Uttarkhand tried to fighback through their captain Ankit, who made some crushing smashes to keep his team in the contest but to no avail, as UP won it 25-18.In the third set, Uttarakhand struggled with their serves and blocks at crucial moments and Uttar Pradesh wrapped it up 25-23 to claim the title.In the girls’ final, West Bengal started in dominant fashion, as they opened up a 14-6 lead before running away with the set. Haryana started the second set eager to make amends and made good smashes to win the first two points. The girls from West Bengal turned the tables through Debangshi Tewari’s excellent smashes and won it 25-19.The third set was a close affair as Haryana, riding on Tamanna’s efforts, matched their rivals. However, West Bengal were quick to get their act together as they rode on Debangshi and Disha Ghosh’s smashing prowess to win the match 25-20.Earlier in the day, Karnataka defeated Tamil Nadu 25-21, 29-27, 25-22 to finish third in the girls’ section.In the boys’ category, Manipur overcame Tamil Nadu 25-20, 25-28, 25-22 to clinch the bronze medal. Karnataka finished fifth.Results: boys: Final: Uttar Pradesh bt Uttarakhand 25-19, 25-18, 25-23Third place: Manipur bt Tamil Nadu 25-20, 25-28, 25-22. Girls: final: West Bengal bt Haryana 25-15, 25-19, 25-20. Third place: Karnataka bt Tamil Nadu 25-21, 29-27, 25-22
